  55. ‌ngx_event_module_t  ngx_iocp_module_ctx = {

  58.     ngx_iocp_init_conf,                    /* init configuration */

  60.     {

  71.     }

  73. };

  75. ‌ngx_module_t  ngx_iocp_module = {

  78.     ngx_iocp_commands,                     /* module directives */
  79.     NGX_EVENT_MODULE,                      /* module type */
  80.     NULL,                                  /* init master */

  87.     NGX_MODULE_V1_PADDING
  88. };

  101. ‌static HANDLE      iocp;
  102. ‌static ngx_tid_t   timer_thread;
  103. ‌static ngx_msec_t  msec;


  106. static ngx_int_t
  107. ‌ngx_iocp_init(ngx_cycle_t *cycle, ngx_msec_t timer)
  108. {
  109.     ngx_iocp_conf_t  *cf;

  111.     cf = ngx_event_get_conf(cycle->conf_ctx, ngx_iocp_module);

  113.     if (iocp == NULL) {
  114.         iocp = CreateIoCompletionPort(INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE, NULL, 0,
  115.                                       cf->threads);
  116.     }

  118.     if (iocp == NULL) {
  119.         ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, cycle->log, ngx_errno,
  120.                       "CreateIoCompletionPort() failed");
  121.         return NGX_ERROR;
  122.     }

  124.     ngx_io = ngx_iocp_io;

  126.     ngx_event_actions = ngx_iocp_module_ctx.actions;

  128.     ngx_event_flags = NGX_USE_IOCP_EVENT;

  130.     if (timer == 0) {
  131.         return NGX_OK;
  132.     }

  134.     /*
  135.      * The waitable timer could not be used, because
  136.      * GetQueuedCompletionStatus() does not set a thread to alertable state
  137.      */

  139.     if (timer_thread == NULL) {

  141.         msec = timer;

  143.         if (ngx_create_thread(&timer_thread, ngx_iocp_timer, &msec, cycle->log)
  144.             != 0)
  145.         {
  146.             return NGX_ERROR;
  147.         }
  148.     }

  150.     ngx_event_flags |= NGX_USE_TIMER_EVENT;

  152.     return NGX_OK;
  153. }


  156. static ngx_thread_value_t __stdcall
  157. ‌ngx_iocp_timer(void *data)
  158. {
  159.     ngx_msec_t  timer = *(ngx_msec_t *) data;

  161.     ngx_log_debug2(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_EVENT, ngx_cycle->log, 0,
  162.                    "THREAD %p %p", &msec, data);

  164.     for ( ;; ) {
  165.         Sleep(timer);

  167.         ngx_time_update();
  168. #if 1
  169.         ngx_log_debug0(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_EVENT, ngx_cycle->log, 0, "timer");
  170. #endif
  171.     }

  173. #if defined(__WATCOMC__) || defined(__GNUC__)
  174.     return 0;
  175. #endif
  176. }


  179. static void
  180. ‌ngx_iocp_done(ngx_cycle_t *cycle)
  181. {
  182.     if (CloseHandle(iocp) == -1) {
  183.         ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, cycle->log, ngx_errno,
  184.                       "iocp CloseHandle() failed");
  185.     }

  187.     iocp = NULL;
  188. }


  191. static ngx_int_t
  192. ‌ngx_iocp_add_event(ngx_event_t *ev, ngx_int_t event, ngx_uint_t key)
  193. {
  194.     ngx_connection_t  *c;

  196.     c = (ngx_connection_t *) ev->data;

  198.     c->read->active = 1;
  199.     c->write->active = 1;

  201.     ngx_log_debug3(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_EVENT, ev->log, 0,
  202.                    "iocp add: fd:%d k:%ui ov:%p", c->fd, key, &ev->ovlp);

  204.     if (CreateIoCompletionPort((HANDLE) c->fd, iocp, key, 0) == NULL) {
  205.         ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, c->log, ngx_errno,
  206.                       "CreateIoCompletionPort() failed");
  207.         return NGX_ERROR;
  208.     }

  210.     return NGX_OK;
  211. }


  214. static ngx_int_t
  215. ‌ngx_iocp_del_connection(ngx_connection_t *c, ngx_uint_t flags)
  216. {
  217. #if 0
  218.     if (flags & NGX_CLOSE_EVENT) {
  219.         return NGX_OK;
  220.     }

  222.     if (CancelIo((HANDLE) c->fd) == 0) {
  223.         ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, c->log, ngx_errno, "CancelIo() failed");
  224.         return NGX_ERROR;
  225.     }
  226. #endif

  228.     return NGX_OK;
  229. }


  232. static
  233. ‌ngx_int_t ngx_iocp_process_events(ngx_cycle_t *cycle, ngx_msec_t timer,
  234.     ngx_uint_t flags)
  235. {
  236.     int                rc;
  237.     u_int              key;
  238.     u_long             bytes;
  239.     ngx_err_t          err;
  240.     ngx_msec_t         delta;
  241.     ngx_event_t       *ev;
  242.     ngx_event_ovlp_t  *ovlp;

  244.     if (timer == NGX_TIMER_INFINITE) {
  245.         timer = INFINITE;
  246.     }

  248.     ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_EVENT, cycle->log, 0, "iocp timer: %M", timer);

  250.     rc = GetQueuedCompletionStatus(iocp, &bytes, (PULONG_PTR) &key,
  251.                                    (LPOVERLAPPED *) &ovlp, (u_long) timer);

  253.     if (rc == 0) {
  254.         err = ngx_errno;
  255.     } else {
  256.         err = 0;
  257.     }

  259.     delta = ngx_current_msec;

  261.     if (flags & NGX_UPDATE_TIME) {
  262.         ngx_time_update();
  263.     }

  265.     ngx_log_debug4(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_EVENT, cycle->log, 0,
  266.                    "iocp: %d b:%d k:%d ov:%p", rc, bytes, key, ovlp);

  268.     if (timer != INFINITE) {
  269.         delta = ngx_current_msec - delta;

  271.         ngx_log_debug2(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_EVENT, cycle->log, 0,
  272.                        "iocp timer: %M, delta: %M", timer, delta);
  273.     }

  275.     if (err) {
  276.         if (ovlp == NULL) {
  277.             if (err != WAIT_TIMEOUT) {
  278.                 ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, cycle->log, err,
  279.                               "GetQueuedCompletionStatus() failed");

  281.                 return NGX_ERROR;
  282.             }

  284.             return NGX_OK;
  285.         }

  287.         ovlp->error = err;
  288.     }

  290.     if (ovlp == NULL) {
  291.         ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, cycle->log, 0,
  292.                       "GetQueuedCompletionStatus() returned no operation");
  293.         return NGX_ERROR;
  294.     }


  297.     ev = ovlp->event;

  299.     ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_EVENT, cycle->log, err, "iocp event:%p", ev);


  302.     if (err == ERROR_NETNAME_DELETED /* the socket was closed */
  303.         || err == ERROR_OPERATION_ABORTED /* the operation was canceled */)
  304.     {

  306.         /*
  307.          * the WSA_OPERATION_ABORTED completion notification
  308.          * for a file descriptor that was closed
  309.          */

  311.         ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_EVENT, cycle->log, err,
  312.                        "iocp: aborted event %p", ev);

  314.         return NGX_OK;
  315.     }

  317.     if (err) {
  318.         ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, cycle->log, err,
  319.                       "GetQueuedCompletionStatus() returned operation error");
  320.     }

  322.     switch (key) {

  324.     case NGX_IOCP_ACCEPT:
  325.         if (bytes) {
  326.             ev->ready = 1;
  327.         }
  328.         break;

  330.     case NGX_IOCP_IO:
  331.         ev->complete = 1;
  332.         ev->ready = 1;
  333.         break;

  335.     case NGX_IOCP_CONNECT:
  336.         ev->ready = 1;
  337.     }

  339.     ev->available = bytes;

  341.     ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_EVENT, cycle->log, 0,
  342.                    "iocp event handler: %p", ev->handler);

  344.     ev->handler(ev);

  346.     return NGX_OK;
  347. }


  350. static void *
  351. ‌ngx_iocp_create_conf(ngx_cycle_t *cycle)
  352. {
  353.     ngx_iocp_conf_t  *cf;

  355.     cf = ngx_palloc(cycle->pool, sizeof(ngx_iocp_conf_t));
  356.     if (cf == NULL) {
  357.         return NGX_CONF_ERROR;
  358.     }

  360.     cf->threads = NGX_CONF_UNSET;
  361.     cf->post_acceptex = NGX_CONF_UNSET;
  362.     cf->acceptex_read = NGX_CONF_UNSET;

  364.     return cf;
  365. }


  368. static char *
  369. ‌ngx_iocp_init_conf(ngx_cycle_t *cycle, void *conf)
  370. {
  371.     ngx_iocp_conf_t *cf = conf;

  373.     ngx_conf_init_value(cf->threads, 0);
  374.     ngx_conf_init_value(cf->post_acceptex, 10);
  375.     ngx_conf_init_value(cf->acceptex_read, 1);

  377.     return NGX_CONF_OK;
  378. }
